intro: Tengia potiflora, commonly known as the pink-flowered spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Tengia potiflora is an important plant for pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies, due to its nectar-rich flowers.
